abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that: ownership
            and commitment of the government are critical for successful
            implementation of the reforms. External agencies like the
            Bank can only facilitate the process by providing technical
            and financial assistance. Reform design has to be state
            specific, recognize the starting conditions and political
            realities of the state. Political economy dimension of the
            power reforms need to be realistically integrated in the
            implementation strategy and expectation of the reform
            outcomes. The expectation of the pace at which the reforms
            can be implemented and the outcomes realized should be
            realistic. Given the socio-political constraints the pace of
            reforms will be determined by the willingness and capacity
            of the governments to address key reform issues. The problem
            of subsidized power supply to agriculture and resistance to
            metering is embedded in distorted agricultural policies and
            political economy factors. Communication with the
            stakeholders is important for successful implementation of
            reforms. Tariff subsidy to the consumers must be explicitly
            defined and transparently delivered without compromising the
            utility's finances. The Government of Andhra Pradesh
            (GOAP) provided substantial support for financial
            restructuring, but the support from financiers and suppliers
            of power (central PSUs) was delayed. The utility managers
            should be selected through a transparent and competitive
            process. A strong Regulatory Commission with autonomy in
            funding and management of its budget, staffing and
            functioning can play a significant role in promoting
            reforms. Reforms are considered synonymous with tariff
            increase which is resisted by all consumers. Integration of
            the financing requirements of the power utilities in the
            medium term fiscal framework of the state governments,
            supported under the Bank's structural adjustment
            program, is useful for improving transparency in public expenditure.
